docinfo.docinfo:doc-heading: 675553 Ontario Ltd. v. Mississauga (City), [2017] O.M.B.D. No. 534

case:info.case:casename: PROCEEDING COMMENCED UNDER subsection 36(3) of the Planning Act, R.S.O. 1990, c. P. 13, as amended Applicant and Appellant: 675553 Ontario Limited Subject: Removal of Holding Symbol: Zoning By-law No. 0225-2007 - Failure of the City of Mississauga to announce a decision on the application Property Address/Description: 90, 100, 110 Dundas Street West Municipality: City of Mississauga PROCEEDING COMMENCED UNDER subsection 51(34) of the Planning Act, R.S.O. 1990, c. P.13, as amended Applicant and Appellant: 675553 Ontario Limited Subject: Proposed Plan of Subdivision - Failure of the City of Mississauga to make a decision Purpose: To permit the development of 140 units, comprising of 120 residential townhouse units and 20 live/work units Property Address/Description: 90, 100, 110 Dundas Street West Municipality: City of Mississauga

case:dates.case:hearingdates: Heard: April 27, 2017. Oral decision: April 27, 2017. Filed: June 2, 2017.

p.text: [Editor's note: An amending decision was released by the Board August 16, 2017. See [2017] O.M.B.D. No. 818.]
675553 Ontario Limited: John Alati, Andy Margaritis, counsel.
City of Mississauga: Michal Minkowski, counsel.

text.emph: MEMORANDUM OF ORAL DECISION DELIVERED BY ANNE MILCHBERG ON APRIL 27, 2017 AND ORDER OF THE BOARD

p.text: 675553 Ontario Limited (the "Applicant" and "Appellant") has appealed the failure of the City of Mississauga ("City", "Approval Authority") to make decisions on three applications concerning a proposed mixed use development, comprised of 21 live/work units and 121 residential units at 90, 100 and 110 Dundas Street West. The City failed to make decisions on applications for:
the removal of a Holding Symbol on the lands;
a draft Plan of Subdivision; and

The proposed development received Official Plan and Zoning By-law approvals from the Board in 2013. The removal of the Holding Symbol, draft Plan of Subdivision and site plan matters were the next steps in the planning approval process. Now under appeal, they are all being heard together.

The Parties informed the Board that they are moving towards a proposed settlement of all three appeals and have agreed on a framework to achieve this. As of this hearing, the Parties' efforts are still ongoing. Mr. Minkowski told the Board that City Council has already dealt with the lifting of the Holding Symbol in a manner satisfactory to the Appellant, and that it will deal with the Draft Plan of Subdivision on or before July 5, 2017.

The Parties also advised that part of the settlement effort consists of an application for Minor Variance ("MV") respecting the proposed development. This application is anticipated to be heard by the City's Committee of Adjustment ("CoA") on June 8, 2017.

Accordingly, the Parties have asked that the settlement hearing be adjourned, and that it resume in the summer, after Council has dealt with the Draft Plan, the CoA has considered the MV application, and the MV appeal period has passed.
The Board orders that the hearing will resume for one day, on Thursday, August 24, 2017, at 10 a.m. at:
